title: Update ya-client-model to version v0.5
body: resolves: https://github.com/golemfactory/golem-internal/issues/503

title: Maintain server connections + receive limit per socket
body:
1. Fixes a case where the server session was closed when reliable forwarding had ended. The node could no longer be found on the server, causing a "not found" error on querying nodes. With this change, server sessions have to be closed explicitly via `drop_server_session` / `drop_session(server_session)`.

2. Introduces a byte size limit for receiving data per socket on each iteration. Consecutive sockets will no longer suffer from read starvation.

Resolves https://github.com/golemfactory/yagna-triage/issues/226

title: Major optimizations
body:
The heart of this PR is the `udp_stream` optimization which applies to both client and server.

- fixed `udp_stream` buffer bottleneck
- virtual TCP socket buffer size increased x3
- "fast lane" for forwarding TCP packets to already resolved nodes
  - cache is reset on disconnection with the relay server
- optimized `Forward::encode`
- **increased** default `StackPollerStrategy` intervals

title: Strict socket re-binding
body: When a remote peer connects to a local listening socket, that listening socket is moved to another (connected) state. Logic inside the network module is responsible for re-creating the listening socket. This PR fixes a situation where such socket was not properly re-bound, resulting in stalled transmission / no possibility to establish new connections

title: Explicitly typed `NodeId` byte ref
body:
`utils::parse_node_id` is susceptible of failing to infer the type of `NodeId::default().as_ref()` :

```
22 |     if id.len() != NodeId::default().as_ref().len() {
   |                    ------------------^^^^^^--
   |                    |                 |
   |                    |                 cannot infer type for type parameter T declared on the trait AsRef
   |                    this method call resolves to &T
   |
   = note: type must be known at this point
```

The described case is common while developing changes to `ya-client` while using `ya-relay` as a dependency (e.g. in `yagna`). This PR fixes the issue by introducing explicit types
